alert.note: Alert for Ford; Grundy; Livingston; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 03 at 11:18AM CST until March 03 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Wet snow expected, with a brief period of heavy snow rates and sharply reduced visibility possible in the mid to late afternoon. Total snow accumulations of up to one to locally two inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 to 50 mph, highest south of the Kankakee River. * WHERE...Portions of central, east central and northeast Illinois. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 10 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Slush may develop on bridges and overpasses and cause a few slick spots during the evening commute. Strong winds south of the Kankakee River could further reduce visibility in falling snow and bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

area.areaDesc: Ford; Grundy; Livingston; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will
